Header: Media Minister refers to removal of obstacles to Media
Content: Mass Media and Finance Minister Mangala Samaraweera has pointed out that the present Government has removed many obstacles to the media. Minister Mangala Samaraweera made this reference addressing the 17th Asia Broadcasting Telecommunication Network conference. The meeting opened in Colombo under the patronage of Ministers Mangala Samaraweera and John Amaratunge, Deputy Minister Lasantha Alagiyawanna and many local and foreign invitees. The aim of establishing the Asia-Pacific Broadcast Development Institute was to create a developed and strong electronic media environment in the area through policies and resource development. In his address Minister Mangala Samaraweera said that wide media freedom prevails in Sri Lanka at present. He pointed out the significance of holding such meetings to build a new media culture. The Minister further pointed out that a new trend of young groups joining the media sphere with the expansion of the social media was being witnessed. Expressing his views on the occasion Minister John Amaratunge mentioned the importance of holding such conferences in Sri Lanka to display to the world that Sri Lanka is a safe tourist destination.
